intro: Cyathea womersleyi, commonly known as the Womersley’s tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and a crown of large, feather-like fronds. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds can grow up to several meters in length, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cyathea womersleyi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
